trans-unit.source: Provides information data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ItemCommand"></xref> event of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref>.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.ListItem*> property.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName*> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The item and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> parameters initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> properties with their respective values.
The `originalArgs` parameter allows you to pass in a set of command arguments, which is useful for handling bubbled events.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.ListItem*> property.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource*> property.
The original arguments inherited from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> object.
Returns the control that raised the event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The control that raised the event.
Gets or sets the name of the default command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> attempts to render a shortcut to invoke the default command.
In HTML, the default rendering in `ListView` displays the first field as a link to the `DetailsView` of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.
By setting the DefaultCommand property, clicking the link invokes the default command.
Invoking the default command raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ItemCommand> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs> object is set to the value of the DefaultCommand property.
Even if a default command is defined, you should include a command with the same name in the commands collection.

If the control cannot render a graphical element that includes a shortcut for the default command, the default command is still available through the rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection>.
To be added.
Returns the list item that generated the event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The list item that generated the event.
